meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7777.

td.p: Megan Beesley, a public defender from St. Louis, Missouri
Joe Castro, a comptroller from Pasadena, California
Leslie Manion, a bookseller from Vancouver, Washington (whose 1-day cash winnings total $599)

tr.td: TRUE CRIME BOOKS, SWEETHEART
PULITZER PRIZE MUSICALS
BALL IN THE FAMILY
HAWAIIAN CROSSWORD CLUES
I DON'T WANNA CRAMP
YOUR STYLE

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Megan] Who is... I can\'t make it out. What does it say?)
(Megan: The Monopoly Man.)
...
(Alex: [To Joe] No, the fictional character who got a real obituary in the New York Times was [*], just after Agatha Christie killed him off in one of her works.)
LeslieWho is Don Corleone
$2,595
MeganWho is The Monopoly
$3,598
JoeWho was Mark Twain?
$3,216
Hercule Poirot')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'He got a real N.Y. Times obit in 1975; it said he wore "false mustaches to mask signs of age that offended his vanity"')

tr.td: FICTIONAL CHARACTERS
He got a real N.Y. Times obit in 1975; it said he wore "false mustaches to mask signs of age that offended his vanity"

Megan
